website_summaries.verdict: Check with your vet first, but if your cat needs a special diet for urinary health maintenance, this may be a good option that is less pricey than prescription diets.
pros: Combines low magnesium levels, quality protein, and balanced nutrition
Ideal for cats that are prone to urinary tract health issues
cons: Not all cats like the flavor or consistency
Has fillers and some artificial flavors
May not be beneficial for cats prone to severe urinary tract crystals

customer_reviews.title: The price is going up and up
customer_reviews.text: The same time last year the food was $14.89. Now it's a little over $21.... that's over a 40% increase in the last year. The food itself is great and works as well as the prescription foods.
customer_reviews.author: Dunkin1433

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: INGREDIENTS CHANGED
customer_reviews.text: How shady of Purina. Not too long ago I was comparing this cat food with another. At that time, the first ingredient listed was CHICKEN. Now the first ingredient listed is CORN GLUTEN MEAL. I knew something was up because all of a sudden I noticed runny poop in the litter box. Now I know why. I’ll surely be seeking out another cat food to buy instead of this because the price should have at least went down on this sub quality product now.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Can't Keep It Down
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could say this food worked, since the food he's eating now (he doesn't need it as bad as his brother) is $7 a pound. The food arrived on a Thursday and he threw up every day, 2x a day, for 4 days. I ended up letting him have a bit of his brother's Royal Canin Rx food. I think this food contains too much corn. Corn products are one of the man sources, along with corn gluten. Cats are carnivores.we won't see them raiding corn fields on the middle of the night. The food is even an unappealing yellow color!! I ended up getting a different brand, one that isn't full of CORN!
customer_reviews.author: Skylover

customer_reviews.title: My 2 finicky cats actually LOVE this.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Wysong Uretic (5lbs for $26) but after problems with shipping time and fluctuating price I decided to try Purina Pro. (7lbs for $16). I'm amazed how much my 2 cats love it. Theses guys do not like me messing with their food. I mixed the two brands to help them with the change over and they started picking around and just eating the Purina and leaving the wysong in the bowl. Purina Pro Plan Dry Cat Food, Focus, Adult Urinary Tract Health Is a great product, plus you get more for less money. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: DoveSoup

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I waited so long to try this
customer_reviews.text: After years of buying prescription cat food due to my cat having urinary stones, I decided to try this and see what happened. I have been using for 3 months now and it was worked out great! My cat loves the food and we have had no urinary issues. Not to mention it saves me about $30.00 per bag.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Helps UTI Symptoms
customer_reviews.text: I have this product on automatic re-order. I can't find it in any local petshop and the price point isn't horrible. My cat loves the salmon and oceanfish flavors. Our vet actually recommended this product as wet food, and this blend in particular, helps UTI issues (or even just the symptoms which my cat frequently displays). I have noticed a significant decrease in my cat's UTI symptoms in just days of using. She has been on this diet (hard food in the am and wet food in the pm) for close to a year now. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who has a cat displaying UTI symptoms.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure my cat would like this because he's very finicky but he loves it. He has small kidney stones and urinary issues and is 17 years old. He didn't like the Science Diet prescription cat food and I just wanted him to eat something made for his urinary tract issues and that he would like. He's partial to fish flavors so I didn't know if he'd like this but he does. He used to eat only one can a day. He puts away 2 of these a day and looks healthier. I don't know if it's the food, but he likes it and eats it all and loves the gravy. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori G.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: My cats, being fed Purina ONE Urinary Tract Health Formula Adult Dry Cat Food, were having some digestive issues. So I ordered this "formula" at double the price. Turns out it has exactly the same ingredients as the stuff I was already buying. So basically Purina relabeled it - and doubled the price.
customer_reviews.author: DeeB

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Poor Quality, Made Cat Sick
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our cat with urine crystals after the Royal Canin urinary SO the vet prescribed was out of stock and we needed an emergency supply of something quickly. Within just one week, our cat began doing his business next to the litter box and eating through packages of human food. It was a drastic change in behavior. This went on for two weeks while we tried to figure out what was wrong. As soon as this food was gone and we switched him back to the expensive food, all behaviors were corrected. The vet said this food upset his system and he was looking for missing nutrients by going after human food like a raccoon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My baby enjoys this food!
customer_reviews.text: My fur-baby seems to like this food - Purina Pro Plan Dry Cat Food (Focus Adult Urinary Tract Health Chicken & Rice Formula). He was having urinary problems resulting in not only peeing everywhere, which was not normal, but then he started pretending to pee places, and nothing would come out :( The result from the vet was that he was having problems with UTI and crystal formation - poor little guy! The vet recommended this specific food along with the same brand of wet food. He eats both right up! I will continue to to feed him this food unless anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing this dry food for my 2 male adult cats for roughly 2 years now - primarily for Urinary crystal issues one of my cats has been prone to develop. My vet perscribed Royal Canine. That product worked very well, but was also very expensive. I researched & researched to find a less expensive solution and decided to give Pro Plan Focus a try. I have not been disappointed whatsoever past 2 years with the effectiveness! My cat w/the UTI issues has been very happy & healthy since eating Pro Plan Focus Urinary. Additionally, both my cats love the taste. And I love it because its not as expensive as RC. Win, win situation for all!
customer_reviews.author: katdrew

customer_reviews.title: I hope it works well for your cat’s health, but not for mine :,(
customer_reviews.text: Sad to cancel subscribe this product and update the review and take some stars off... One of our cats needs special food for urinary tract health and had taken this product for a while. First 2 months, it seemed work well. But we needed to take him to the vet due to the serious problem of crystal thing last week and he stayed there 2 nights. And we paid $2500 (we really appreciate that our pet insurance covered 90% of it!!). I really wish this product works for his health, but not for him. He loved its taste tho, so it might be good for other cats who has a little bit of the urine problem, I hope so.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: The prescription cat food is super expensive and our cats didn't really like it
customer_reviews.text: Our cat had to go to the hospital when his urinary tract became clogged with crystals. The prescription cat food is super expensive and our cats didn't really like it. They like this much better and we have had no recurrence of urinary tract problems after 4 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A Great Addition To Kitty's Crystal Prevention Diet
customer_reviews.text: My one year old Persian developed painful crystals. We use Pro-Plan Urinary Tract Health wet food and a vet purchased name brand dry to prevent crystals. My cat did not like vet brand wet food so I was excited when I saw Purina had something for urinary crystals too. Pro Plan is reasonably priced which is nice and he actually eats it! I am thankful we have found a good blend of products that help prevent crystals and keep kitty happy. As of our last vet visit we have no crystals present in his urine! WooHoo!
customer_reviews.author: K. M. E.

customer_reviews.title: Works for my cat
customer_reviews.text: One of our cats had a urinary issue and the vet recommended a prescription cat food. We bought that for a while, but she is a very picky eater and we were wasting money. I tried this Purina Urinary Tract wet food, and she both liked it and has not had any more urinary problems. (I am not saying you should ignore your vet's advice; I would have gone back to the prescription food if problems had recurred.) The ocean whitefish is Sophie's favorite flavor, but we also purchase the turkey and giblets variety and she likes that too. I have been very pleased with these products.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: They like it!
customer_reviews.text: After several close-in-time emergencies in which my guy became blocked by crystalline mineral deposits, I tried working this product into his meal plan. He ate it more readily than the 3 times costlier prescription brands that he got on his first Please Bring Him In Now! visit. (That’s what the tech said when I described his (growling at litter box then hiding) symptoms on the phone.) (And she was right.) I feed this to the group and not just to the one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Foxmore

customer_reviews.title: Reduction in food!
customer_reviews.text: THIS USED TO BE A 5-STAR RATING! NOT ANYMOREI noticed the can food has changed. Back in December 2019, one of the cans look extremely different from the rest. I almost notified the company because I thought it was a bad can. Turns out, they were changing the AMOUNT of food in each can. NOW, you get 1/8 less cat food per can. These are small cans, so taking away food leaves a noticeable gap! The can is filled with gravy, and loosely packed food, and big surprise, the price is still the same! My cats really like this food, which is unfortunate for me, as it is too expensive for the quality of what I'm getting.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old Siamese was starting to have issues with very strong smelling urine that appeared sparkly (from crystals). I decided to give this a try and after 1 1/2 weeks of transitioning her to this food exclusively, the smell and crystals are gone. She also seems to have more energy and is shedding less. She is finnicky about her food but she seems to like this a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: I think my cat stays living just for this food
customer_reviews.text: I have a 20 year old cat that was not doing the best. She started going the bathroom right outside of her litter box and I found some crystals in her urine. Thought it was time to put her to sleep. I was on amazon and came across this cat food. Thought I would give it a try. OH MY GOD. My cat LOVES this and definitely has a little more "pep in her step" since introducing this. The crystals are gone, she is going the bathroom in her litter box again....and seems to be happy with her life. Cray Cray. Get this stuff. Your cat will love it.
customer_reviews.author: kbc77

customer_reviews.title: The texture of this has changed and is no longer a pate.
customer_reviews.text: It is not the pate consistency anymore, and I ended up giving away two cases of this canned food. I cannot understand why Amazon stopped carrying the pate, and instead carries the ground up food. My cat refuses to eat the ground up version. I tried her for three days, and she simply refused to eat. That was long enough for me to get the point. Off to pick up canned cat food locally. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Shops Frequently

customer_reviews.title: Great food, high price
customer_reviews.text: This food is fantastic, and the cats love it too. I'd be sold on it as a daily feed if it weren't for the ridiculous price Purina charges for it. Not to mention the pricing seems to vary from month to month. What's the price for it today? Who knows, maybe more, maybe less than last week. For now, I use it only when there's an active pee problem, otherwise if it were cheaper I'd use it every day. The cats seem to like it better than their "everyday" food also.
customer_reviews.author: InterTube Consumer

customer_reviews.title: helped with the urinary tract problem of my cat but my cat does not like it
customer_reviews.text: My adult cat has kidney disease and I bought this cat food to help with that. When I first bought it my cat liked it and her kidney problem started to get much better. After a while though she wanted to eat the cat food my other cats eat. It became more and more of a struggle to make her eat it. Sometimes she would eat a fresh opened can but when it came out of the fridge she did not want it. I started to put a dab of the other cat food on top of it and sometimes she would eat it. It is still a struggle and I don't think I will buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Works great and my cat LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: After my kitty went thru a significant urinary tract infection we switched to this food at the recommendation of our vet. He has been eating both the wet and dry food for four years and not a single recurrence of bladder issues. The best part is he loves the food. We give him the canned food as his 'dinner' and the crunchy dry kibble is available all day. So I give it five stars - it keeps him healthy, he likes the taste, the price is reasonable and Amazon delivers it to my door. Whats not to love?
customer_reviews.author: carol anne

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as from the vet
customer_reviews.text: My cat had urinary crystals and after being treated I purchaed the vet's brand wet food for a while and then found Purine, who I've always trusted had food that was for the same problem. I gave it a try. She loves, the price is a little cheaper, it's delivered to my door and seems to be working. I still get her dry food with the urinary tract stuff from the vet. It's much cheaper then an line and she loves it too. There is also a treat named FLOW that I get for her from Amazon that is good for the problem and she doesnot eat unhealthy ones.
customer_reviews.author: pat blackmon

customer_reviews.title: Freddie Approves
customer_reviews.text: We have a cat with urinary tract issues (Struvite Crystals). We beleive his issue was caused by the food we used to feed him. But this is the only urinary tract health food that he will eat. We have tried others, and he will not eat it. And he only likes the chicken entree. My 7 year old took the picutres of Freddie. Although there is no pick of him eating the food, if you can see his size, it is obvious he eats..lol. I like this product, and the fact that we can order it without having to pay for a vet visit all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Nifong

customer_reviews.title: Great for for our cat! He loves it and it loves him!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this food! He couldn’t even wait to eat it and was tearing into the bag. He won’t even eat his old Blue Buffalo food anymore. Hopefully it will help his urinary issues. The blue buffalo food was giving him urinary problems and crystals. That food caused him to be blocked up. Blue Buffalo is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F

customer_reviews.title: Cleaner up UTI quickly.
customer_reviews.text: My kitty had chronic UTI's, he just finished a round of meds when he started getting another UTI. I was told to buy crazy expensive cat food that I couldn't afford so I googled alternatives and I found this food. I couldn't find it in stores but luckily Amazon carrie's it. It cleared up his UTI in about 2 weeks and it's been over a month now my cat is healthy as could be. The only downside is my cat doesn't like the taste of this food and if he overindulges it gives him loose poop. At this point I really don't care if my cat likes the food or not it's keeping him health.
customer_reviews.author: Retrofitblonde

customer_reviews.title: Cats will actually eat it.
customer_reviews.text: My wife has three cats. The youngest one has had on-going urinary problems. We needed cat food that would be good for all three and that they all would eat. The prescription brand we got from the Vet was a waist as the cats just refused to eat it. So far, all three are eating this cat food and it is good that the other cats who are quite a bit older than the one with urinary issues like it as it should help protect them from the frequent urinary problems almost all cats get as they age.
customer_reviews.author: DANNY ELLER

customer_reviews.title: packaging defective
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product because the bag looked like it was opened and resealed and poorly at that. I will not risk what could possibly be inside against my cat's health. That is the real reason, but I have to comment on the ingredients and the blurbs on the back of the bag that I stupidly did not look over when I purchased the product... what possible BENIFIT could corn gluten mean, wheat flour (known for causing problems for cats with urinary issues) brewers rice, ground yellow corn and whey have on the maintaining a normal ph for cats or a healthy urinary trac? None is the answer. It just makes them sick.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this food. I have been buying ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food. I have been buying this for 7 years since he had a urinary blockage. He eats canned food and this dry food every day. He has not had a urinary problem since eating this food.
customer_reviews.author: iteachmom

customer_reviews.title: Causes my cats to physically assault me at 5am
customer_reviews.text: This stuff must be good because my cats sure do seem to need it at 5 am. They will start by jumping on the bed and staring at me. If that doesn't work, I am gently prodded by a paw on the face. If that doesn't work, out come the claws. Please know my 16 lb diva is not afraid to draw blood. I recommend getting up before the claws come out, stumbling to the kitchen, opening up a couple cans of this apparently delicious stuff, and then trying to go back to bed with the sweet knowledge that you can get in an hour if claw- free sleep before it's time to get up for work
customer_reviews.author: Yepmeamalie

customer_reviews.title: Its good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: My old cat after 18 years, gets a UTI. Took me a couple days to figure out what was going on. Some of the recommend over the counter medicine worked fine, but two weeks later, UTI back again. So switched her over to this UTI formula cat food, as well as Purina's dry UTI cat food. Not had an issue with the UTI's since. And for a picky eater, she seems to really like the wet food and eats the dry well too. So, its a win win.
customer_reviews.author: M. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Great product for my cat who has a history of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product for my cat who has a history of crystal problems due to high pH. She was only 3 years old when she first started having this problem, this cat food has kept her pH and crystals at a healthy level for the last (nearly) 2 years (she turns 5 in April).
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Gobble It Up
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Pro Plan Urinary Focus wet food for my 2 cats recently. They absolutely LOVE taste of this wet food! I use it along with Pro Plan Focus Urinary dry food to help deter & control UTI's. One of my male cats had crystals develop in the past so he needs "special" food to keep him healthy & happy. As most "parents" of felines w/UTI's know - cats need lots of water to help prevent UTI's. I mix both the wet food feeding w/water (make it a soup) and also mix water with their dry food feeding. Pro Plan Focus Urinary has not disappointed my cats nor me! Great product and I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: katdrew

customer_reviews.title: Keeps cats hydrated
customer_reviews.text: Our vet unblocked a mucus plug in our male cat. The vet said cats are notorious for not getting enough water to stay hydrated. This food is very wet and the cat gets water through the food as he eats. Our vet really didn't think our cat was going to make a recovery but was surprised to find him very hydrated upon his last examination. The key is to keep the cat hydrated enough to keep the urinary tract flowing fluid and not plugging up. Since using this food, our cat has had no urinary problems and is doing great.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard

customer_reviews.title: He had a very bad urinary tract infection w/ crystals
customer_reviews.text: This cat food may have literally saved my cats' life. He had a very bad urinary tract infection w/ crystals. He was on antibiotics for 14 days w/ no improvement. The vet suggested trying wet food for urinary care and we tried this. Within 3 days our cat was no longer peeing blood and has continued to be crystal free for 8 months now. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: SAMSDoll

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed as none of my three indoor cats will eat this or the other Pro Plan (sensitive skin & stomach) I purchased. I was certain they would as I feed them Pro Plan Focus Dry Hairball Management (bought from Chewy because not available in large size here) as well as Purina Beyond Simply Grain Free Ocean Whitefish & Egg Dry Food. I’ve always sworn by Purina for years but lately this is the third canned variety my cats have refused to eat.
customer_reviews.author: LaVenus Rawley

customer_reviews.title: She's been treated and is feeling better, but that is how well regulated this food ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat is UTI prone and this food works for us. When we ran out 3 days before the next bag arrived, I went and bought some basic meow mix thinking just 3 days on regular food wouldn't hurt. I was wrong. She got a new UTI in that 3-day span just being off this food. But hadn't had one in the more than year she'd been eating it or since that one. She's been treated and is feeling better, but that is how well regulated this food keeps my kitty, at a better price than the prescription foods.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as indicated
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats, sisters. One has had an UTI. Was necessary to put both cats on an UTI food. It took sometime; however, both cats are both eating Purina Pro Plan UTI canned & their dry UTI. Actually, the nonUTI cat has actually lost some weight after being on this food. The UTI cat has not had an UTI episode since being on this food, I am keeping my fingers crossed that this continues. Love the convenience of getting the UTI food on Prime w/two day shipping. The cost is great compared to more expensive brands, and it is working for my cats.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H

customer_reviews.title: the only food my elderly cat can eat
customer_reviews.text: We have a 21+ year old cat who has a very sensitive stomach. It's nothing for her to throw up multiple times a day, especially in the morning at daylight. This is the ONLY food she cat eat without issue. Even the other version of this food causes her to be sick. I am very grateful to have found a food that she likes, a food that she can eat without terrible consequences. Hopefully, this food will keep her a live for many more years. She is putting weight back on, which is incredible ! She is getting back to her old self again.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Taylor

customer_reviews.title: My kitty has been eating this for a year and ...
customer_reviews.text: My kitty has been eating this for a year and the last delivered got her sick so I cancelled my orders.. I lost my Baby Bear kitty last year after feeding him this and I am starting to think it might have had something to do with his death!!!
customer_reviews.author: George Henderson

customer_reviews.title: She is super finicky and would not eat any of the vet ...
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old female Russian Blue had a urinary infection that lasted 4 months and hundreds and hundreds of dollars. She is super finicky and would not eat any of the vet prescribed foods. I kept hunting around and having her try different urinary diets, and finally found this one! Within a month, her urinary crystals cleared up. It's been 4 months since her infection and I am just so grateful that this food worked and she loves it!! I also give all of my other cats this and the canned turkey giblets of the same brand and they all love it!
customer_reviews.author: kmm808

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to expensive vet prescription brands
customer_reviews.text: My cat was having urinary problems and going in places he shouldn't have been. The vet recommended I start feeding my cats the Science Diet, but it was $30 for not even a week supply (I have 3 cats and I can't feed them separately). There's just no way I could afford to do that, so after reading multiple reviews we went with the Pro Plan. It's a great price, especially if you subscribe and save on Amazon. We don't even run out before our next shipment arrives. So for a little over $20 we have more than a month supply.
customer_reviews.author: SMJJ

customer_reviews.title: Quality without an Rx
customer_reviews.text: One of my male cats has recurring urinary issues and this food was recommended by my vet as an alternative to prescription food. My cats eat it, but they don't LOVE it. I think they are bored with the same dry food all the time. I have to watch the male cat closely but, fingers crossed, I haven't had any emergency visits to the vet in quite some time now.
customer_reviews.author: PJBLargo

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality of storage before shipping
customer_reviews.text: I opened the car of food in my dark kitchen, but did notice there's a lot of mud-like dust on the plastic outer packaging. Checked the expiration date and it's fine, so I didn't think anything of it. I just reached for a can and noticed it had dead/dried bug larvae on them, as did the majority of the other cans. This leaves me to question the conditions in which it was stored. My cat, who isn't a picky eater, wouldn't touch it yesterday. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: MindyH.

customer_reviews.title: only thing my cat will eat
customer_reviews.text: My cats gets crystals in his urine and we were told he needed a special diet. i tried a couple brands before this and my cat clearly did not like any of them. once i bought the chicken in gravy he was all about it! great for me considering the price being about half of the other brands
customer_reviews.author: Jessica reuter

customer_reviews.title: RC prescription with Pro Plan FOCUS work well for my cats health
customer_reviews.text: Both cats eat this formula because it is easier to feed them that same thing, rather than buy 2 different types of food. One cat on prescription diet for over 2 years and still give them canned Royal Cannin SO along with Purina Urinary diet dry. Purina Focus is fairly balanced for UTI and less expensive than Dry RC SO formula, though I will stick with RC prescription canned because it best for urinary health. My cats doing okay on this, though it may not work for all felines with special UTI needs. Check with your Vet first.
customer_reviews.author: Digibug

customer_reviews.title: Has basically saved my cat's life
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with FUS. This food is affordable compared to the Iams and Science Diet. He is almost 10 years old now and my vet said most cats with FUS don't live past 2 or 3. I will admit he does not like it as much as other food. He manages to get a bite here and there of the other cats food but he does eat it and he is very healthy. Zero flare ups with the FUS since he has been on this.
customer_reviews.author: A. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Cornflakes
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened the package it smelled like cornflakes mixed with some kind of medicine. I should have known better than to buy this since the 1st ingredient was Corn Meal, but I assumed that since Chicken Meal was listed next that it would be okay. Shouldn't assume. Cat's wouldn't eat this even though I mixed it 1/2 & 1/2 with their very expensive Prescription CD dry veterinary food. Now I'm spending a lot of time picking this out of the CD food since the CD is soooo expensive I can't bear to waste it :(
customer_reviews.author: QualityBrands

customer_reviews.title: My cat and my wallet love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our vet suggested wet food for our cat after crystals were found in his urine. She suggested the Royal Canin Urinary Tract wet food, which our cat refused to eat (fine by me, it costs a small fortune). I asked about a store brand option and she suggested this. He LOVES it. Paws at me when it's meal time (something he has never done before). It's 3x cheaper than the Royal Canin food, so I love it too!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Food great, but got shortchanged twice
customer_reviews.text: I just switched to this 3-flavor 36 pack because it was a better value. The first box arrived with only one flavor, I just got the replacement box today and it only has 2 of the 3 flavors. Serious quality control issues. To be clear though, the problem is with the multi pack, not the quality of the food itself. My boys love the food.
customer_reviews.author: cg3

customer_reviews.title: If your cat has UTI issues you need this product to help.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product due to the fact my cat had crystals and blood in his urine. Had a bad UTI infection. My Vet recommended UTI food to help him. I have been using this for about a year now. He has not had any issues. I have been giving it to my female cat as well. It was to hard to buy 2 different types of food. My cats LOVE this brand the best. I would definitely recommend this product if your cat has UTI issues. UTI food
customer_reviews.author: Friendly

customer_reviews.title: NONE OF MY CATS WOULD EAT IT...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this product sooo much due to one of our cats having a peeing issue...but unfortunately none of my cats would eat it. I'm not sure if it's the flavor, I got a bad batch, or what. I've purchased other Pro One products and my cats loved them...so I can only say it's this particular line of food they disliked. I hate leaving negative reviews/stars but unfortunately my cats just didn't like it. My 3-stars is for effort, packaging & shipping.
customer_reviews.author: K9-TRIGUN

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE. THIS. STUFF.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only urinary tract wet food my cats will eat. I've tried the fancy high-end stuff which they hated so much they refused to eat it and lost weight. They liked the Purina ProPlan dry food so I tried this. They even beg for it and run to their dishes when they hear the can open. I bought the salmon and whitefish varieties and they like each of them equally. They have put on the weight they lost but have not gained beyond that. Have not had a urinary tract issue in either cat since starting this. Oh, and the price is much better than at Amazon than the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Terner

customer_reviews.title: Tarzan is happy now
customer_reviews.text: Purina Pro Plan Urinary Tract wet food was a huge find for Tarzan. He didn't like any food for several weeks after his urinary tract difficulties. I marveled at how a cat could NOT eat even when he must have been really hungry. He finally ate some of what his veterinarian offered (after multiple tries of many different kinds). In desperation I tried various things from Amazon, and luckily he decided Purina was just fine. It has been over a year. now, so with fingers and paws crossed we continue to get Purina! In fact he is reminding me to order some right now.............
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Good for my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat has to have special food or his tiny bladder develops crystal shards that plug up his urethra. He eats the vet purchased KD food. The Purina urinary track care cat food is the only other food he can eat and I’m super thankful it, both the wet and dry versions of it. I don’t want to condone going against vet suggestions. I researched a lot before choosing this food for my cat. My cat loves the food and it’s smell. I don’t love the smell but I don’t have to eat it. It’s not so stinky that I notice it in the room. Just when I open the can. My cat likes the whitefish flavor the most.
customer_reviews.author: Nikinak

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: My oldest cat has early onset Kidney Disease. She isn't at the point where she needs vet prescribed food yet, so we looked into this brand. We went over it with the vet and she gave us the green light. This wet food, paired with the dry food of the same kind, has helped her gain the weight and get the moisture she needs in her diet to combat her KD. Her coat is shinier and she doesn't shed as much. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Too high in calories?
customer_reviews.text: One cat loves it, the other cat doesn’t but eats a little. After a few minutes one cat gives up on it. It seems like it’s thick to them like peanut butter. I was feeding my sphynxes small can daily but with unlimited dry food too they were getting fat. Now it’s a once weekly treat and just greenies and urinary hard food. The weight is coming off slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good  but weak scent for my 3 cats...
customer_reviews.text: What did the cats (3) dislike? After the 1st serving the food seems to loose its strong scent. Scent is that important to cats, so they wouldn't eat it. On occasion, if I warmed food in microwave it would bring out a stronger scent. The quality is very good, just needs to smell stronger for a longer time period. Using the 3 oz cans is not practical or cost effective in 3 cat household.
customer_reviews.author: SueZQ's favorite flowers!

customer_reviews.title: My three cats love Purina
customer_reviews.text: My male cat loves food, but if he eats any cat food aside from Redford he will throw up (sensitive stomach and UTI issues since kittenhood). Instead of using the recommended vet food I looked to this because it is way cheaper, but still helps him keep it down. He loves Purina as do my other two cats who always demand a mix of the Pro Plus and indoor chicken kibble morsels throughout the day. Cant go wrong with this brand and for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Acacia

customer_reviews.title: Helps keep Stones at bay
customer_reviews.text: I use this (canned urinate tract health) for my boy cat who is prone to getting crystals in his urine. I feed this to him once per day along with a supplement called vets best urinary tract support - I do add a little extra water just to be safe. So far, we haven’t had any issues ! I highly recommend this if your cat has urinary issues .
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this food and it may be helping manage his struvite crystal problem
customer_reviews.text: Our cat started peeing blood about a month ago and was diagnosed with struvite crystals in the bladder. Passing one of those had lacerated his urethra, poor fellow. We were told to put him on s/d food for a couple of weeks followed by c/d food. I bought various "urinary" wet food cans to see what he might like, and he seems to like this one best. Actually he likes it better than the non-urinary food we had him on before. His symptoms have not returned and he has put on some much needed weight. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Suggs

customer_reviews.title: The one canned cat food that's she's craving now
customer_reviews.text: My cat has a sensitive digestive tract. Some foods really cause her great grief. But the one Purina Pro Plan Wet Food, Turkey. I've tried the chicken but her favorite is turkey. I've presented this almost exclusively lately. In the past I've tried everything, even cooked fresh chicken and duck. Which she liked too but it wasn't a practical long term solution. Now I have this brand of turkey cat food as her primary meals and she gets several snacks and vitamins and wholesome treats to keep her healthy and happy. So far so good. Ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Aspiring Veganista

customer_reviews.title: Special food for urinary problem
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a cat that has had severe urinary problems, requiring hospitalization. The food the Vet ordered is quite expensive and he does not like the taste.He likes this product and it seems to work well for him. Along with the special wet food the Vet ordered and this dry substitute, Simba is doing well.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Great cat food!
customer_reviews.text: This cat food is GREAT! We have a cat who kept getting UTIs. After a LOT of research, we found the perfect combination of wet and dry food. Not only is this great for preventing UTIs (he hasn’t had one since), but he LOVES the chicken in gravy flavor!!! He’s picky and won’t eat the paté, so we’re glad we found some real chicken chunks for our little Chunk! 😊
customer_reviews.author: Sakura Chan

customer_reviews.title: At home preventative UTI
customer_reviews.text: Scent? It smells like cat food. Flavor? Yeah... I’m not tasting it. My cat eats it though. Value? Well, there’s definitely less expensive foods out there. However, my cat has recurrent UTIs. In addition to those making him miserable, he also pees anywhere and everywhere. So the value to me is not paying for everything to clean that up. It’s one of the least expensive that I’ve found (if you find one cheaper let me know!) The pack lasts about a month
customer_reviews.author: Emily S.

customer_reviews.title: I like the price rage and kibble size but my cats hate this food
customer_reviews.text: I tried out this product because price was cheaper than science diet UTI dry food and also science diet changed their kibble size bigger recently witch is inconvenient for me because their big kibbles jamming our fancy food feeders. I was happy with the product that the kibble was small enough to work with the feeders, and also I love the price range............ but My cats are hating it(sight). they have been refused to eat this product for 2 days now. I am just so sad that this product didn't worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Hyeryeong

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my girl
customer_reviews.text: This was a great option for my dehydrated 13 year old cat. I feel like every time I go out of town, she gets urinary tract infection. It's like she just decides not to drink water because I'm gone. It's also an older cat issue, the older they get the less water they drink. To help with this I give her a can of wet food every morning. I integrate these into her diet, even if she doesn't have a uti as well as D-Mannose.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, seems to work!
customer_reviews.text: We started using this food for my 5 year old boy kitty a couple years ago. I've only bought it on Amazon because it is so convenient and the price has always seemed fair. I have two cats and one cat likes it and the other will not eat it. The other cat uses Royal Canine Urinary Dry Food with olfactory stronger smell. The cat that eats this food will not eat that food. We put both cats on Urinary health type food and neither one has had an infection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picky eater eats it, no further complications
customer_reviews.text: Our cat had the crystals in his urine and had to go to the vet for the procedures to help him with that. He was supposed to go on a prescription food, but we use this instead. It's been years, and he has never had any further issues. Our other cat is a super picky eater but he loves this stuff. We had to get those pet feeders with RFID readers to keep him out of the special food!
customer_reviews.author: Steffuls

customer_reviews.title: Kitties love/ ingredients could be better
customer_reviews.text: The kitties LOVE it! Only reason I gave it 4 stars was because the ingredients could definitely be better. I buy this because my kitty has urinary track issues & the only other non prescription brand that I know of is royal cannon.... their ingredients list is horrible. Mostly grains and corn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat does not like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this under the recommendation of a vet to help my senior cat with litterbox troubles. She loathes the taste and smell. She would not touch a bowl of the stuff and frankly, I don't blame her. The food smells terrible. I've been mixing it with her old food but she has a tendency to spit out the bad stuff and eat her old food. I recommend buying the smaller size bag first to see if your kitty is willing to eat it.
customer_reviews.author: marsh

customer_reviews.title: Cats say “meow”
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I needed to switch one of my cats to a special urinary health diet, I’ve been using these in addition to a different brand of UR medicated wet and dry food. The cats seems the like the more liquidy ones as opposed to the flavors that require a bit more chopping up and preparation before feeding. Good cheaper alternative for the really expensive medicated food I need to buy. I have this set on a subscription so I never have to remember to repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: DubStef

customer_reviews.title: My cat enjoys this food!
customer_reviews.text: My cat seems to really enjoy this food. She is 14 years old now and I think the softer food mixed with her usual dry kibble has been working out very well for her. It It has not been upsetting her stomach so far, so I’m assuming I can continue to feed it to her and watch her carefully for possible side effects. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Former New Yorker

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: My cat had recently started urinating on my bed and other odd places my house. Turns out she had developed a uti or bladder infection. I paired this food twice daily with a 1/2 tablespoon of Braggs ACV and Homeopet UTI health drops and it cleared right up! The taste and smell of this masked the taste of the medication and vinegar well
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Saved my cats life!
customer_reviews.text: My male cat had a fully blocked urethra over a year ago and had to take him to the emergency vet. The vet said they would have to keep him for days and catheterize him and remove the blockage. The cost was going to be over 3grand! I told the vet to just clear him out as best he could and i would take Him home, as i could not afford to pay for that. The vet did his best to unblock the cat and sent him home with a $300 bill. Sanchez has been on this food for over a year and hasnt had any issues since.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Shave

customer_reviews.title: preferred by myself and my cats
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple cats. I also foster cats and kittens for rescues. I have found that pro plan food gives better results in terms of health, growth, coats. I have a cat who tends to have health issues if I don't feed this food. also, most cats prefer the taste of the various types of pro plan. the kitten pro plan is my favorite, although plain old purina kitten chow is best for weaning. but then moving them to pro plan gets you healthy beautiful and adoptable kittens.
customer_reviews.author: L. Treat

customer_reviews.title: Sent me EXPIRED food. Cat got sick, no refund!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat has been eating this for years with no problems - it’s his favorite! However this last 16lb bag we purchased here, we noticed strange behavior: diarrhea, unusual amt of throw-up after eating (not hairballs) and the most unusual - he doesn’t finish his 1/8 portion! (Our cat is a pig in disguise!) Just noticed that this bag is EXPIRED! I only bought it in June and unfortunately passed the deadline to return.
customer_reviews.author: Vash

customer_reviews.title: Loony loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only UT formula that my cat likes and will eat regularly. He is fussy and has a "delicate stomach". His name is Loony because he chases Martians.
customer_reviews.author: Mai

customer_reviews.title: Adorable food to keep my cats weight and bladder in check
customer_reviews.text: My cat is not picky at all and loved this food. It has a pretty standard pet food scent that isn't off-putting unlike some fishy canned foods that I've used in the past. Doesn't make my cats stool and urine smell particularly bad and passes through my kitties stomach just fine. My cat is prone to issues surrounding dehydration like constipation and urinary stress so wet food is a must, this one keeps her hydrated enough to not have issues even with her lack of drinking. From what Ive read on reddit this branned is a go to for vets because it's affordable and keeps cats healthy.
customer_reviews.author: El Brayan

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found this
customer_reviews.text: Glad I found this cat food on Amazon. One of my senior Siamese Seal point cat-boy needs the Urinary food but he was so bored with the same-old Prescription cans and kibble. He was "pissed off" which added to the need for Urinary food. He does like this Purina Pro Plan Focus Urinary Tract Health Chicken & Rice Formula Adult Dry Cat Food. It must be actually helping his urinary output, based on the increased size of clumps in the litter box. We will hope that he will continue to be healthy and happy. CATMAMA
customer_reviews.author: teacher

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend it for cats with urinary problems or give it ...
customer_reviews.text: I give it to our 4 cats once in a while. They are eating it because they usually eat Purina Pro plan focus weight management for adults cats. I guess both have similar flavor. The size of this food bites is slightly bigger than Focus weight management. But my cats are still young so they don't mind. I would recommend it for cats with urinary problems or give it occasionally to maintain a health urinary system. No side effects.
customer_reviews.author: Jane G.

customer_reviews.title: Effective Product Cats Will Eat!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because cat was prescribed Hills Science Diet for urinary tract issues, but he does not like the paste consistency of it. I tried Purina brand, which has a chunky consistency and he loves it. I supplement with dry urinary tract food and so far have had no reaccurance of UTI issues. Very happy with this product and it's saving me $$. Give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Greta

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep my cat healthy
customer_reviews.text: My cat started spraying and peeing about a year ago out of nowhere. He is fixed. We brought him to the vet and he had crystals in his urine. He would pee blood and strain while trying to go. With the use of this product and medication, he is much better under control!! He is the pickiest cat ever and he gobbles down the food! The dry food, not so much lol.
customer_reviews.author: sean donahue

customer_reviews.title: Very small cans for the price
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes it a lot. What I dislike is that it is so expensive for very small cans. The cans should at least be the size of an average size can for the price. My cat is a large cat and would easily eat 3 cans a day. I can't afford that so I have to alternate with regular cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Julie W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect substitution for the prescription food
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this food for our cat for at least 10 years now after the cost of the prescription food for his urinary tract issues skyrocketed (and the vet required frequent, costly checkups in order to refill the prescription). He loves it, and he has remained healthy and active and lean.
customer_reviews.author: Hall Ways

customer_reviews.title: Damaged cans
customer_reviews.text: My cats like it. Only complaint I have is my last order nearly every can was severely dented and extremely difficult to open and the plastic was all tapped together. It wasn't anything to do with the shipping because the other case of smaller cans in the same box and the box itself was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michele C

customer_reviews.title: More Affordable than RX food !
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my fluffy gal because she had a urinary tract inflammation. She also has a few small crystals. The Vet recommended prescription food, which is quite expensive. A box of 24 cans is $50 to be exact. My gal like the food ( thank goodness ). The downside, the cans are only 3oz. I stretch the food by adding Purina UTI dry food. I also purchased Tinkle Tonic to give her several times a week to keep the inflammation at bay.
customer_reviews.author: Sunnygirl

customer_reviews.title: could see it was painful for him
customer_reviews.text: Cat had crystals ... not pleasant ... blood in urine ... could see it was painful for him. After visiting vet, I read many reviews and medical advise (other sites) and this cat food is his primary diet now. No more crystals. No more pain. Happy cat. Happy me. I read somewhere (I'm a google freak) that if a cat eats only wet/canned food (vs dry), they should never have urinary issues. I tend to believe this after the results I've seen -- which were almost immediate. Roy is only 3 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Teri W

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great - now it's not
customer_reviews.text: Our cat has been eating this food for six months with very good results for her urinary issues. Within the last two months, I noticed that the texture of the product is different -- stiffer, as though it has more gelatinous ingredients and less soft, meaty ingredients -- and now my cat will not eat it. She used to dive into each plate and beg for more. Purina, don't go messing with these formulas! This has a profound impact on pets and pet owners.
customer_reviews.author: Pat B.

customer_reviews.title: Devours all of this leaves none behind!
customer_reviews.text: My vet prescribed Hill's Presciption Diet c/d for urinary tract problems. My 6 yr. old 10 lb. male would eat about 1/4 of the can and I had to throw the remainder out. Not good and it's more expensive than this Purina formula. He eats the entire can and leaves not one tidbit! He was raised on Fancy Feast but never ate it like he does this one! He has blocked twice, not a pleasant experience for him, me or the vet. And it's hard to catch at the onset. Now I get large urine clumps in his litter box and am very happy to see the improvement after only a week of feeding him Purina.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cats with recurring crystals/stones/UTIs!
customer_reviews.text: For the longest time we were paying A TON of money for prescription cat food to help with my cats recurring crystals/stones... until we came across this food. This has been a life saver for my cat and our wallets! Works just as well as the stuff the vet prescribes at a fraction of the cost. We have not had any vet visits since switching to this food. Highly recommend for cats that are prone to recurring urinary issues. This stuff is gold! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not helpful for cats with crystals
customer_reviews.text: Well, this definitely doesn't help my cat with crystals. Reading through the reviews, it sounds like the manufacturer has responded with "This isn't supposed to help cats with crystals. It is to support healthy bladder function." Well, um, maybe I'm missing out on something here, but if a cat has a healthy bladder, what kind of support does it need that justifies the increased price of this stuff? What exactly is in this that a cat with a healthy bladder should have, presumably so their bladder doesn't go unhealthy. I don't get it.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Gname

customer_reviews.title: Cat with kidney problems tolerates well
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with kidney problems. He is prone to bladder and kidney infections and after 2 very expensive rounds of treatment at 4 years old I switched him to urinary tract prescription dry food and Purina Pro Plan Focus wet food. This is not a prescription wet food so I was hesitant at first but he has had no problems with it - I feed the food 2-3 times a week to increase his moisture intake because he will not drink enough.
customer_reviews.author: RJG

customer_reviews.title: The Cats Love It
customer_reviews.text: One of my male cat has had some UTI issues so I switched his wet food to see if it would help. During this process he has been on meds so I can’t say as of yet if it is helping or not. However, I can say that both my cats love it and I have noticed that their fur has changed and they are both so so soft! One is short hair the other long and they both are silky smooth....
customer_reviews.author: Gina Pioli

customer_reviews.title: Avoided costly urinary procedure for the cat!!! Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I welcome you cat lovers to visit my Facebook page to see BISCUIT and my few other cats. Had Biscuit in the ER one Sunday night as he had a urinary blockage. They wanted to keep him overnight but it would have cost me $2000!!! Forget it. Did my research. Hills & Royal Canin way too expensive. Have had all 4 male cats on this AND the Purina 1 urinary dry food. Have avoided the costly urinary procedure!!! Biscuit finally peeing more & more. We are a living testament. I posted about it... Brett Warnelis Palm Bay Florida
customer_reviews.author: Brett Warnelis

customer_reviews.title: my ragdoll cats
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Urinary Tract Health Adult Dry Cat Food because both cats are neutered & I want them to stay healthy! MY CATS BOTH SPIT OUT THE KIBBLES & MADE A FACE! I bought the first Focus while the cats were eating Urinary Tract Health Formula. Which they really like!! April 4th I received the second Focus 16 oz cat food. I am returning the unopened package, and reordering the Urinary Tract Health Formula. And I learned a good lesson!! The Urinary Tract Health Formula is less money & makes for healthy , happy , beautiful boys!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer t

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Loves It
customer_reviews.text: My tortie has had 2 UTIs back to back so I'm using the Purina Urinary Tract Health wet food. I must say Figgy loves the ocean whitefish and chicken...not so much the beef and chicken. I give her 1/2 a can 2 times a day. I'm very pleased that she's been UTI free for several months since starting this program. I was buying it at the pet store, but it's less expensive through Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: MAM

customer_reviews.title: my cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: lol i can’t comment on the flavor since i didn’t eat it but my cat seems pleased. keep in mind if your cat is having urinary problems it’s not just the ph it’s a hydration issue usually. so when i give this to my cat i mix extra water in. it gets him to drink more. he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to the high priced special diet foods
customer_reviews.text: My cat was diagnosed with a UTI earlier this year. I have been feeding him Blue Buffalo kibble. I have been unsuccessful with switching him to the UTI dry formulas because of the high grain content. This is an affordable alternative to the high price canned wet special diet food. My cat loves it and the smaller can size is just right with minimal waste. My vet mentioned this Purina food line.
customer_reviews.author: Lara A. Sciaraffa

product_meta.title: Purina Pro Plan Focus Urinary Tract Health Adult Wet and Dry Food
product_meta.description:
Style:Wet Food| Color:Chicken in Gravy| Size:(24) 3 oz. CansGive your darling cat extra care nutrition to meet her specific needs with Purina Pro Plan FOCUS Urinary Tract Health Formula Chicken Entree in Gravy adult wet cat food. This wet urinary tract cat food reduces urinary pH and provides low dietary magnesium to help maintain her urinary tract health. Every serving provides 25 essential vitamins and minerals plus taurine, an amino acid, to help support her overall health and wellness, and this recipe is formulated to help support your cat companion's healthy immune system for added peace of mind. This urinary cat food features real chicken and other high quality ingredients you can trust, while the delicious taste and tender texture help to keep your cat engaged during feedings. Give your cat a tasty experience that delivers time after time with an order of Purina Pro Plan FOCUS Urinary Tract Health Formula Chicken Entree in Gravy adult wet cat food.

REVIEW
PURINA PRO PLAN MONEY BACK GUARANTEED
We guarantee outstanding quality and taste. If for any reason you’re not satisfied with our product, please let us know why.
You must include: 

a brief explanation of why you were dissatisfied your original receipt with the price circled the “BEST IF USED BY” date from the packaging for Wet foods, the UPC for Dry foods, the Weight Circle your name your street address (a PO Box will not be accepted) Send within 60 days of the purchase date on your receipt to:
Pro Plan Satisfaction Guarantee Office of Consumer Affairs
P.O. Box 1326
Wilkes-Barre, PA 18703
feature_bullets: Helps maintain urinary tract health by reducing urinary pH and providing low dietary magnesium
Helps support a healthy immune system
Provides extra care nutrition for specific needs
Twenty Four (24) 3 oz. Pull Top Cans Purina Pro Plan Urinary Tract Health Gravy Wet Cat Food; FOCUS Urinary Tract Health Formula Chicken Entree

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
